intro: Pediomelum cuspidatum, commonly known as the hooked pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. Pediomelum cuspidatum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
